title: Supreme Court of India
summary: The Supreme Court of India (IAST: Bh훮rat카ya Ucchatama Ny훮y훮laya) is the supreme judicial body of India and the highest court of the Republic of India under the constitution. It is the most senior constitutional court, and has the power of judicial review. The Chief Justice of India is the head and chief judge of the Supreme Court, which consists of a maximum of 34 judges and has extensive powers in the form of original, appellate and advisory jurisdictions.[3]
